Based on the search results, I found comprehensive information about Polish stage adaptations of "The Little Prince" (Mały Książę), including Polish Radio Theatre productions:

## Polish Radio Theatre Adaptation

The Polish Radio Theatre (Teatr Polskiego Radia) presented "Mały Książę" with premiere on April 8, 2023, directed by Kamil Małanicz. The radio play was created to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the book's publication on April 6, 1943, noting that the story has been translated into over 300 languages and dialects.

## Major Polish Theatre Adaptations

The search results reveal extensive theatrical activity around "The Little Prince" in Poland:

### Recent Productions (2023-2024)
- Warsaw's Polski Theatre (Teatr Polski im. Arnolda Szyfmana) premiered on May 19, 2023, directed by Konrad Dworakowski
- Teatr Nowy in Zabrze premiered on February 17, 2024, directed by Cezary Domagała
- Teatr Lalek Banialuka in Bielsko-Biała premiered on April 14, 2024, directed by Filip Jaśkiewicz
- Teatr "Pinokio" in Łódź premiered on May 25, 2024, directed by Dorota Abbe

### Historical Productions
The encyclopedia of Polish theatre documents numerous adaptations dating back to 1958:
- The first television theatre adaptation premiered on May 26, 1958, directed by Jerzy Gruza
- Teatr Śląski in Katowice premiered on April 4, 1959, directed by Zofia Truszkowska

## Critical Reception

"The Little Prince" is noted as one of the most frequently staged theatrical productions in the world, not only on professional stages. The book is reported to be translated into approximately 300 languages (with some sources citing up to 382 languages), making it one of the most translated books after the Bible.

The Warsaw Polski Theatre production received particular attention for its staging. "The Little Prince" at Polski Theatre retained the intellectual, humanistic content of the original and completely captivated with its fairy-tale atmosphere. The production was praised for maintaining the original text while proposing very interesting scenic and visual solutions.

## Adaptations Across Poland

The search results show that "The Little Prince" has been adapted by virtually every type of theatre in Poland - from puppet theatres to dramatic theatres, from amateur to professional companies. Major Polish cities including Warsaw, Kraków, Wrocław, Poznań, Łódź, Katowice, and many others have hosted productions over the decades, demonstrating the enduring appeal of Saint-Exupéry's work in Polish theatrical culture.
